"Jumbo Pictures."

Summary: Doug has always been the target of Roger's taunts, until lately he learned to put down Roger, and everyone is laughing. But now Doug just can't stop being Mr. Funny Guy at the expense of his friends' feelings, until he realizes the comeback remark isn't always as funny as it seems.

Reviews three American collections of comics particularly in light of their reactions to the Sept. 11, 2001 terrorist attacks: Putain, c'est la guerre=Get Your War On (David Rees) ; Boondocks: Parce que je sais (Aaron McGruder) ; and Attitude: the New Subversive Political Cartoonists (ed. by Ted Rall).

notes: Summary: Mr. Abernathy proposes they putt everything out, but his golfing companion has second thoughts.

116.heading: Putting.
116.title: "Cured your Putting Problems?"
116.author: by Chip Dunham.
notes: Summary: Charley cured his slicing and bad drives too, by throwing his clubs overboard.

117.heading: Putting.
117.title: "Don't Worry, Those Golf Caps Usually Pop Right Back Into Shape"
117.author: Mort Walker.
notes: Summary: Fuzz tries to give the general tips on putting, and ends up with his own hat stuffed into his mouth.

118.heading: Putting.
118.title: "Grampa! Yoyo is Practicing Putting!"
118.author: Russell Myers.
notes: Summary: Appearances are deceiving, because really he's hunting gophers with a golf club.

119.heading: Putting.
119.title: "He Can't Turn It Off!"
119.author: Mort Walker.
notes: Summary: Sarge always hits the golf ball over 300 yards, which is a problem when he putts.

120.heading: Putting.
120.title: "I Can't Hit Anything With It!"
120.author: Swan.
notes: Summary: After a frustrating session putting into a can indoors, he throws his putter out the front door and hits a man.

121.heading: Putting.
121.title: "I Married Him for Better or Worse, and it Didn't Take Me Long to Find Out Which One it Was"
121.author: by Bob Barnes
121.appears_in: reproduced on p. 114 of Golf in the Comic Strips, ed. by Howard Ziehm (General Publishing Group, 1997). Setting: The husband is practicing his putting in the house.

122.heading: Putting.
122.title: "I Putt for IOUs"
122.author: MacNelly Productions.
notes: Summary: The Professor muses about the saying, 'Drive for show, putt for dough.'

123.heading: Putting.
123.title: "I Wish I Could Sink My Putts as Regularly as I Sink My Drives"
123.author: Thaves.
notes: Summary: Frank is watching the ripples on a small body of water on the golf course.

124.heading: Putting.
124.title: "If Your Handicap is Above 15 Putt for This Hole"
124.author: by John McPherson.
notes: Summary: The green has two holes, of very different sizes.

125.heading: Putting.
125.title: "I'll Never 3-Putt Again! I'll Never 3-Putt Again!"
125.author: Mort Walker.
notes: Summary: General Halftrack tries positive thinking to improve his golf game.

126.heading: Putting.
126.title: "I'm Putting Here, Matt!"
126.author: Jenkins-Burns.
notes: Summary: Mark, Gil and Matt talk about the coming football season while on the golf course.

127.heading: Putting.
127.title: "Is This an Army Office or a Golf Course?"
127.author: Mort Walker.
notes: Summary: In the general's office, the women are primping and the men are putting.

128.heading: Putting.
128.title: "It says 'Four-Putt'"
128.author: MacNelly.
notes: Summary: Shoe can read the green just fine.

129.heading: Putting.
129.title: "It was a Par Five. I was On in Two, and I Four-Putted!"
129.author: Chance Browne.
notes: Summary: Hi wakes up from a nightmare.

130.heading: Putting.
130.title: "It's the Only Time All Week I Feel Superior to Anybody"
130.author: by Dean Young and Stan Drake.
notes: Summary: A round takes forever, but Herb likes playing with Mr. Dithers, who takes five or six putts every green and sends half his drives into the woods.

131.heading: Putting.
131.title: "I've Been Told I'm Generous to a Fault"
131.author: Duffy.
notes: Summary: Al is putting, and Axel asks him what his handicap is.

132.heading: Putting.
132.title: "I've Never Lost One Putting Before!"
132.author: Bittle.
notes: Summary: Artie's upset because he's lost a golf ball.

133.heading: Putting.
133.title: "Kids Can Be So Cruel"
133.author: MacNelly.
notes: Summary: Skyler gets called 'Four-Eyes,' and Cosmo gets called 'Four-Putt.'

134.heading: Putting.
134.title: "Koff Koff"
134.author: by Millar-Hinds.
notes: Summary: A caddy uses a megaphone to cough during a putt.

135.heading: Putting.
135.title: "A Little Putting Doesn't Hurt Anything"
135.author: Mort Walker.
notes: Summary: Ms. Blips doesn't like the General doing golf in the office.

136.heading: Putting.
136.title: "Miss"
136.author: by Auth & Szep
136.appears_in: reproduced on p. 134 of Golf in the Comic Strips, ed. by Howard Ziehm (General Publishing Group, 1997).
notes: Summary: One golfer is watching another one putt, and we see the thought balloon of the watcher.

137.heading: Putting.
137.title: "Mr. Palmer, This is the White House Calling. The President Would Like To Know if You Would Like to Swap Comeback Stories"
137.author: Jim Berry
137.appears_in: reproduced on p. 124 of Golf in the Comic Strips, ed. by Howard Ziehm (General Publishing Group, 1997).
notes: Summary: Richard Nixon is shown putting in his office.

138.heading: Putting.
138.title: "Nerves of Graphite"
138.author: by Schulz.
notes: Summary: Charlie Brown compliments Snoopy on his putt, and Snoopy explains.

139.heading: Putting.
139.title: "Never Played a Veterinarian Before, Huh"
139.author: Geo
notes: Summary: A golfer has birds, a mouse, a frog, and Heathcliff helping him line up a putt.

140.heading: Putting.
140.title: "A New Beginning"
140.author: by Tom Wilson
140.appears_in: reproduced on p. 140 of Golf in the Comic Strips, ed. by Howard Ziehm (General Publishing Group, 1997).
notes: Summary: Ziggy sinks the putt for a personal best score, then discovers he's put the ball in a rabbit hole.

141.heading: Putting.
141.title: "Now He Gets Ahold Of One"
141.author: by Jim Toomey.
notes: Summary: Fillmore needs one tiny putt to win (Fillmore is the turtle).

142.heading: Putting.
142.title: "Obnoxious Gurgling Sounds"
142.author: by John McPherson.
notes: Summary: A golfer is putting for birdie, and objects to the noise his companion is making as he gets eaten by an alligator.

143.heading: Putting.
143.title: "A Plugger Putting on the Green"
143.author: Brookins.
notes: Summary: Mowing the lawn with a riding lawnmower (putt-putt).

144.heading: Putting.
144.title: "Putt Stops"
144.author: by Garry Lants
144.appears_in: reproduced on p. 136 of Golf in the Comic Strips, ed. by Howard Ziehm (General Publishing Group, 1997).
notes: Summary: Basil watches silently as a putt does not go in.

145.heading: Putting.
145.title: "Quiet, Ruth. This Putt's for All the Marbles at Pebble Beach!"
145.author: by Paul Nichols ; LeDoux and Wilson.
notes: Summary: The girls say goodbye to Grandpa at the cemetery; meanwhile Mr. Cabot practices putting indoors.

146.heading: Putting.
146.title: "The Robert Frost Caddy School"
146.author: Hart
146.appears_in: reproduced on p. 131 of Golf in the Comic Strips, ed. by Howard Ziehm (General Publishing Group, 1997).
notes: Summary: The caddy reads the green, saying, 'The blades are lovely, green and slick, Just perfect for your putting stick'.

147.heading: Putting.
147.title: "A Seventy-Foot, Downhill Putt"
147.author: by Parker & Hart
147.appears_in: reproduced on p. 159 of Golf in the Comic Strips, ed. by Howard Ziehm (General Publishing Group, 1997).
notes: Summary: The doctor has a thousand-dollar bill framed on his office wall.

148.heading: Putting.
148.title: "Spring Must Be Near"
148.author: Larry Wright.
notes: Summary: Kit is putting in the living room.

149.heading: Putting.
149.title: "SSSS SSSS SSSS"
149.author: by Millar-Hinds.
notes: Summary: A caddy uses an atomizer to keep from coughing during a putt.

150.heading: Putting.
150.title: "There's Nothing in the Rule Book Against Putting Like This"
150.author: by Johnny Hart.

151.heading: Putting.
151.title: "This Should Be an Easy Putt"
151.author: [No author]
notes: Summary: Giants are using Bugs' rabbit hole for golf.

152.heading: Putting.
152.title: "Trying Not to Beat Him at His Own Game"
152.author: Kin.
notes: Summary: She casually sinks a six-foot putt.

153.heading: Putting.
153.title: "Unfortunately, I Had Three"
153.author: Dik Browne
153.appears_in: reprinted on p. 153 of The Best of Hi and Lois (Bedford, N.Y. : Comicana Books, 1986).
notes: Summary: Hi tells Thirsty that one drink relaxes him before a game of golf. Thirsty falls asleep while lining up his putt.

154.heading: Putting.
154.title: "Wait, Avery Wants to Putt"
154.author: King.
notes: Summary: Bill and Walt stand on the green and argue about Walt's score, and Avery gets impatient.

155.heading: Putting.
155.title: "Who are those Two Guys Putting down the 18th Fairway?"
155.author: Cullum & Marshall.
notes: Summary: They're almost out of balls, but they want to finish the course.

156.heading: Putting.
156.title: "The Winds are Famously Tricky on This Course"
156.author: by Millar-Hinds.
notes: Summary: If McDivot makes the putt, Tiger Woods doesn't play and the ratings are in the toilet; military stealth technology goes into play.

157.heading: Putting.
157.title: "You Can't Putt 300 Yards!"
157.author: Unger.
notes: Summary: A golfer starts the hole with a putter.

158.heading: Putting.
158.title: "You Have What It Takes to Outdistance Your Competition"
158.author: Kelso & Kemp.
notes: Summary: Her putt goes right past the hole.

159.heading: Putting.
159.title: "You Sunk a 35-Foot Putt!!!"
159.author: by Cathy Guisewite.
notes: Summary: Cathy discovers she's good at golf.

160.heading: Putting.
160.title: "You Talking to Me?"
160.author: Hart
160.appears_in: reproduced on p. 145 of Golf in the Comic Strips, ed. by Howard Ziehm (General Publishing Group, 1997).
notes: Summary: The interviewer asks a great putter how he concentrates ; the golfer pulls out earplugs.

161.title: "Putting All Her Eggs in One Basket"
161.author: Bela Zaboly.
notes: Summary: Aunt Jones shows Popeye his baby book, and says his mother brought him to her in a basket.

162.heading: Putting Down.
162.title: "A Book you Simply Can't Put Down"
162.author: by Dave Coverly.
notes: Key words: Flying books, coffee tables.

163.heading: Putting Greens.
163.title: The Blank in the Comics strip collection includes a file of one or more daily comic strips related to this keyword or topic. Call no.: PN6726 f.B55
163.author: [No author]

164.heading: Putting Greens.
164.title: "I Told Her Twice, But She Didn't Answer"
164.author: Young & LeBrun.
notes: Summary: Dagwood has this idea about making the backyard into a putting green.

165.heading: Putting Greens.
165.title: "Indoor Putting Green"
165.author: by Carl Anderson
165.appears_in: reproduced on p. 110 of Golf in the Comic Strips, ed. by Howard Ziehm (General Publishing Group, 1997).
notes: Summary: Henry uses a bearskin rug for indoor golf.

166.heading: Putting Greens.
166.title: "It's Some Big Problem He's Working On"
166.author: Greg & Mort Walker.
notes: Summary: The General is having all his office furniture moved out, and doesn't say why. We see his new putting green.

167.heading: Putting In a Good Word.
167.title: "How About Two Good Words?"
167.author: S
notes: (Ratbert the Consultant)
Summary: Ratbert promises to put all employee input in a binder to be stored in the same building where the boss works, and to put in a good word for them.

168.heading: Putting into Tumblers.
168.title: "Hullo, Desmond, Old Ding-Dong. Where's 'The Brain?'"
168.author: Alex Raymond
168.appears_in: reproduced on p. 432 of The Comic Strip Century (Northampton, MA : Kitchen Sink Press, 1995)
notes: Summary: Rip is putting badly into a tumbler on the carpet, and Desmond gives him a lesson before he answers the doorbell to admit Miss Honey.

169.heading: Putting into Tumblers.
169.title: "I Worry About Him Sometimes"
169.author: Alex Graham.
notes: Summary: In the living room, Fred's master is shouting with joy because he made a putt into a tumbler for an imaginary championship.

170.heading: Putting into Tumblers.
170.title: "Indoor Putting with Cat"
170.author: Walt Wetterberg.
notes: Summary: The cat gives the ball a swat, and it goes off the wall into the tumbler.

171.heading: Putting into Tumblers.
171.title: "Just Halt the Chase and Stop all the Bouncing and Bumping?"
171.author: by Chip Dunham.
notes: Summary: Although the prey looks rich and easy to catch, the pirate captain is putting into a tumbler in his cabin.

172.heading: "Putting Notes"* (Peanuts, July 11, 1997) / by Charles M.
172.title: Schulz.
172.author: [No author]
notes: Summary: Notes are falling from Schroeder's score, and Snoopy is putting them into a bucket.
Panel without words.

173.heading: Putting Off.
173.title: The Blank in the Comics Strip Collection includes a file of one or more daily comic strips related to this keyword or topic. Call no.: PN6726f.B55
173.author: [No author]

174.title: "Putting on the Dog"
174.author: [No author]
174.series: The Atom) p. 21-26 in Big All-American Comic Book
notes: Summary: The Atom thwarts jewel thieves taking advantage of a dog lover. Features Rollo, the Wonder Dog.
Data from David Stepp.
Also titled by another indexer: "Help for a Dog"*

175.heading: Putting One's Foot Down.
175.title: "I Guess Now She Knows Who's Boss!"
175.author: Penn.
notes: Summary: Woody put his foot down and walked out on the chores his wife wanted him to do. He doesn't seem to know he's wearing an apron on the golf course.

176.heading: Putting Out Fires.
176.title: "You Know How To Put Out Fires, Don't You?"
176.author: Gordon Bess.
notes: Summary: Redeye tells Pokey to help his mother with breakfast.

177.heading: Putting Out the Cat.
177.title: "The Cat Naps"
177.author: by Holloway.
notes: Summary: Shorty says he put out the cat, and if you don't believe it put her out yourself.

178.heading: Putting Out the Cat.
178.title: "How Did He Catch On Fire?"
178.author: Shelton & Sheridan
178.series: The Adventures of Fat Freddy's Cat
178.appears_in: in The Simpleton, v. 1, no. 3 (Spring 1976) ; also appears in in The Adventures of Fat Freddy's Cat, bk. 3 (1977)
notes: Summary: Freddy asks Franklin to help him put out the cat.

179.heading: Putting Out the Cat.
179.title: "I Forgot to Put Out the Cat Before I Went to Bed!"
179.author: Russell Myers.
notes: Summary: Yoyo puts the cat out with one punch.

180.heading: Putting Out the Cat.
180.title: "Put Out the Cat"
180.author: Myron D
notes: About a Golem.

181.heading: Putting Out the Cat.
181.title: "Put The Cat Out"
181.author: George Herriman
181.appears_in: p. 67 in The Smithsonian Collection of Newspaper Comics, ed. by Bill Blackbeard and Martin Williams (Washington, D.C. : Smithsonian Institution Press, 1977).

182.title: "Putting Out the Fire"
182.author: by June Brigman and Mary Schmich.
notes: Summary: Ms. Puffington attacks the cleaning lady with insults and a wastebasket, and Brenda goes to intervene.
Key words: Overpaid, underdressed slobs, trash.

183.heading: Putting Practice.
183.title: "I Look On Him as the Indoor Equivalent to a Sand Trap"
183.author: Larry Wright.
notes: Summary: Kit is doing some putting practice, and Carlyle watches the ball attentively.

184.heading: Putting Practice.
184.title: "Whoever Wins Has To Pick Up the Dog Doo in the Backyard"
184.author: [No author]
notes: Summary: An innocent bet on the putting practice course.

185.title: "Putting the Books Back in Comic Books"
185.author: Nat Gertler on comic books
185.appears_in: p. 22-23 in Hogan's Alley, v. 2, no. 3 (=no. 7) (1999).
notes: (The Quarterly Planet)
Column on book-length comics and trade paperback collections.

186.heading: Putting the Cart Before the Horse.
186.title: "That's Really Putting the Heart Before the Course"
186.author: by Bob Thaves.
notes: Summary: Frank calls from the clubhouse, to find the others have gone to a Valentine's party instead.

187.title: "Putting the Litter"
187.author: Ever Meulen
notes: Inside front cover.
Title from contents page.

188.heading: Putting Things Away.
188.title: The Blank in the Comics Strip Collection includes a file of one or more daily comic strips related to this keyword or topic. Call no.: PN6726f.B55 "putting away"
188.author: [No author]

189.heading: Putting Things Away.
189.title: "She Had On Her Slappin' Look!"
189.author: Cal Alley & Katie Mac.
notes: Summary: Winky thinks better of telling Missy to put her things away.

190.heading: Putting Things Off.
190.title: "Divorce" 1 p. in National Lampoon Presents Claire Bretecher
190.author: [No author]
notes: Summary: A woman works up her anger to tell her husband she wants a divorce, but then puts it off until tomorrow.

191.heading: Putting Things Off.
191.title: "Mow the Lawn? How About Four Days from Now?"
191.author: Jim Davis, Brett Koth.
notes: Summary: Mr. Potato Head is trying to put it off.

192.heading: Putting Things Together.
192.title: "And All the King's Madmen Couldn't Put Deathlok Back Together Again, or Could They?"
192.author: Rich Buckler, Bill Mantlo, story ; Rich Buckler, pencils ; Klaus Janson, inks
notes: Data from George Olshevsky.

193.heading: Putting Things Together.
193.title: "How Many Lesbians Does It Take To Put Together a Basketball Goal?"
193.author: Paige Braddock

194.heading: Putting Up.
194.title: The Blank in the Comics Strip Collection includes a file of one or more daily comic strips related to this keyword or topic. Call no.: PN6726f.B55
194.author: [No author]

195.title: "Putting Words in President's Mouth"
195.author: Howard and Virginia Freeman
195.appears_in: p. 16A in the St. Petersburg Times, Aug. 20, 2004.
notes: Letter to the editor objecting to a Pat Oliphant cartoon about George W. Bush.

196.title: "Putting Your Mouth to Good Use : Some Great Oral Tips"
196.author: by Goupil and Walter
196.appears_in: p. 18 in Heavy Metal, v. 27, no. 3 (July 2003).
notes: About oral sex.

197.title: "Putting Your Pants On While Running"
197.author: by Dean Young
197.appears_in: p. 68 in Battered Husbands (Redondo Beach, CA : H. Gregory Associates, 1991).
notes: Summary: Dagwood has the knack, Herb doesn't.

198.title: Putnam, John F., 1917-
notes:
American comics editor (art
        director)
